About.Hours & facilities: Open 1 June to 31 October Mon-Fri 10am-4pm; 1 November to 31 May 10am-1pm 7 days a week; open all Easter; closed 23 December - 4 January. General reference assistance available. Copying services available for books, journals, original records to A3, photographs, newspapers, maps and plans.

About.Acquisition focus: The history of Broome including its pearling industry, the lives of the people who make up its multicultural community and its significance as a bombed town during World War II.

About.Major holdings: Local Pearling Businesses: Ledger and employment records 1890's-1950's. Sub Collector of Customs Broome: Records of imported pearling crews 1910-1975. The West Australian: News articles on Broome 1950's-1991. Fisheries Department WA: Register of Pearling Divers and Crew 1912-1940's. Jean Haynes (nee Kennedy): Family Albums and Mementoes 1905-1987.

About.Guides: Reference guide to Broome Pearling Masters with listing of their luggers 1913-1941, 1947-1970. Reference guide to Lugger Records for Broome 1913-1941, 1947-1970.

Contact.Street address: Corner of Saville and Hamersley Streets, Broome 6725
